      generate a String of UTF-8 characters (or hex-digits if byteStream isn't UTF-8 chars) from byteStream, truncating to maxLen (with "..." added if the result is truncated)

      • readBytesFromStream

        public static byte[] readBytesFromStream​(java.io.InputStream source)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        read all bytes from an InputStream; doesn't close input-stream
        Parameters:
        source - the input stream to consume
        Returns:
        the bytes read from 'is'
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if anything goes wrong reading from 'is'

      • readBytesFromStream

        public static byte[] readBytesFromStream​(java.io.InputStream source,
                                         int bufferSize)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        read all bytes from an InputStream with the specified buffer size; doesn't close input-stream
        Parameters:
        source - the input stream to consume
        bufferSize - the buffer size to use when reading the stream
        Returns:
        the bytes read from 'is'
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if anything goes wrong reading from 'is'

      • copyContentIntoOutputStream

        public static long copyContentIntoOutputStream​(java.io.InputStream source,
                                               java.io.OutputStream target,
                                               int bufferSize,
                                               boolean readToEOF)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        the real work-horse behind most of these methods
        Parameters:
        source - the source InputStream from which to read the data (not closed when done)
        target - the target OutputStream to which to write the data (not closed when done)
        bufferSize - the size of the transfer buffer to use
        readToEOF - if we should read to end-of-file of the source (true) or just 1 buffer's worth (false)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • cloneContent

        public static java.io.InputStream cloneContent​(java.io.InputStream source,
                                               int readbackSize,
                                               java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream target)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        used when you want to clone a InputStream's content and still have it appear "rewound" to the stream beginning
        Parameters:
        source - the stream around the contents we want to clone
        readbackSize - the farthest we should read a resetable stream before giving up
        target - an output stream into which we place a copy of the content read from source
        Returns:
        the source if it was resetable; a new stream rewound around the source data otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any issues occur with the reading of bytes from the source stream

      • cloneContent

        public static java.io.InputStream cloneContent​(java.io.InputStream source,
                                               long readbackSize,
                                               java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream target)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        a convenience method to reduce all the casting of HttpEntity.getContentLength() to int
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • toUtf8StringOrHex

        public static java.lang.String toUtf8StringOrHex​(java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream byteStream,
                                                 int maxLen)
        generate a String of UTF-8 characters (or hex-digits if byteStream isn't UTF-8 chars) from byteStream, truncating to maxLen (with "..." added if the result is truncated)
        Parameters:
        byteStream - the source of bytes to be converted to a UTF-8 String
        maxLen - the point at which to truncate the string (-1 means don't truncate) in which case "..." is appended
        Returns:
        the String read from the stream
